newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait frees 405 inmates, including 10 Jordanians.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait frees 405 inmates, including 10 Jordanians.

text.p: Kuwait will on Tuesday free 405 prisoners, including 10 Jordanians convicted of undermining state security, in celebration of independence and liberation days, an official statement said.
Another 590 prisoners were granted reduced sentences as part of the amnesty by Emir Sheikh Jaber al-Ahmad al-Sabah.
Kuwait on Tuesday celebrates its 1961 independence from Britain and Wednesday is the sixth anniversary of the end of the Gulf War, which forced Iraqi troops out of the tiny state.
Kuwait severed ties and generous financial aid to Jordan and the Palestine Liberation Organisation (PLO) for siding with Iraq during the crisis and has turned down overtures to improve ties.
After the war scores of Palestinians and Jordanians were jailed on charges of collaboration with Iraqi forces during the seven-month occupation of Kuwait.
